support_summary: Proximity ligation assays (PLA) confirmed a direct interaction between ATXN3 and Cullin 1 (CUL1), a core component of SCF E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3, a deubiquitinase, directly interacts with Cullin 1 (CUL1), the central scaffold protein of the Skp1-CUL1-F-box (SCF) family of E3 ubiquitin ligases. SCF complexes polyubiquitinate a wide range of substrate proteins, targeting them for proteasomal degradation.
functions.effect_description: This interaction allows ATXN3 to directly antagonize the action of SCF E3 ligases. By deubiquitinating substrates targeted by an SCF complex (such as CHK1), ATXN3 can reverse the degradation signal and rescue the protein from destruction, thereby creating a regulatory balance.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds to CUL1 → Deubiquitination of SCF complex substrates → Reversal of SCF-mediated degradation signal → Increased stability of target proteins
specific_effects: ATXN3 directly interacts with the core E3 ligase scaffold protein CUL1.
The interaction provides a mechanism for ATXN3 to counteract ubiquitination mediated by SCF complexes.

evidence.paper_title: Nuclear ATXN3 DUB physiological substrates: towards understanding their role in the context of Machado-Joseph Disease | FENS 2022
ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3

mechanism: ATXN3, a deubiquitinase, directly interacts with Cullin 1 (CUL1), the central scaffold protein of the Skp1-CUL1-F-box (SCF) family of E3 ubiquitin ligases. SCF complexes polyubiquitinate a wide range of substrate proteins, targeting them for proteasomal degradation.
effect: This interaction allows ATXN3 to directly antagonize the action of SCF E3 ligases. By deubiquitinating substrates targeted by an SCF complex (such as CHK1), ATXN3 can reverse the degradation signal and rescue the protein from destruction, thereby creating a regulatory balance.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits CUL1 to modulate scf e3 ligase activity, ultimately affecting increased stability of target proteins.

evidence.paper_title: Nuclear ATXN3 DUB physiological substrates: towards understanding their role in the context of Machado-Joseph Disease | FENS 2022
ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3
